stimulusHtml: A battery of emf Ɛ, switch, resistor R1 of resistance R, resistor R2 of resistance 2R, and inductor of inductance L are connected as shown in the circuit diagram. The switch is closed and remains closed for a long time. Immediately after the switch is opened, the electric potential difference across the inductor is equal to 2Ɛ. Which of the following provides a correct description of why the potential difference across the inductor is twice the potential difference of the battery?
choicesHtml: The current in the inductor must remain the same immediately before and after the switch is opened because of conservation of charge. Because the resistor in the loop with the inductor is 2R, the potential difference across the inductor must be 2Ɛ.

The potential difference across the inductor increases over time when the switch is closed. When the switch is opened, the potential difference is released through Resistor R2. Because the resistance of R2 is twice the resistance of R1, the potential difference across the inductor is twice the potential difference of the battery.

When the switch has been closed for a long time, the current from the circuit is stored in the inductor. When the switch is opened, the stored current is released through Resistor R2. For the current to be the same, the potential difference of the inductor must be twice the potential difference of the battery.

The charge in the inductor increases over time. It becomes fully charged when the switch is closed for a long time. After the switch is opened, the stored charged is discharged through Resistor R2. Because the resistance of R2 is twice the resistance of R1, the potential difference of the inductor is twice the potential difference of the battery.
